lines.line_text: And for the Guests that were to dine,

stanzas.stanza_text:
GAY  liking  Wine,
A noble Meal bespoke us;
And for the Guests that were to dine,
Brought  and

lines.line_text: The God near  drew his Chair,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The God near  drew his Chair,
Near  plac'd;
For  makes  forget its Care,
And  exalts a Feast.

lines.line_text: The more to please the sprightly God,
Put on some Cloaths to come abroad,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The more to please the sprightly God,
Each sweet engaging
Put on some Cloaths to come abroad,
And took a Waiter's Place.

lines.line_text: While  swore he'd drink the Lass,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Then  nam'd at every Glass
A Lady of the Sky;
While  swore he'd drink the Lass,
And had it Bumper-high.

lines.line_text: took care to fill him more,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Far  tost his Brimmers o'er,
And always got the most;
took care to fill him more,
When-e'er he mist the Toast.

lines.line_text: They call'd, and drank at every touch;
And if the Gods can take too much,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Gay  little  stung,
By reck'ning his Deceits;
And  mock'd his stamm'ring Tongue,
With all his stagg'ring Gaits:

And  droll'd on Ways,
And Tales without a Jest;
While  call'd his witty Plays
But Waggeries at best.

lines.line_text: Such Talk soon set 'em all at odds;
I'd sing ye, how they drunk like Gods,
And how they fought, like Men.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Such Talk soon set 'em all at odds;
And, had I  Pen,
I'd sing ye, how they drunk like Gods,
And how they fought, like Men.

lines.line_text: To part the Fray, the  fly,
Nay, had the  selves been nigh,
They still were three to three.

stanzas.stanza_text:
To part the Fray, the  fly,
Who make 'em soon agree;
Nay, had the  selves been nigh,
They still were three to three.

lines.line_text: And gave him back his Bow;
But kept some Darts to stir the Cup

stanzas.stanza_text:
appeas'd, rais'd  up,
And gave him back his Bow;
But kept some Darts to stir the Cup
Where Sack and Sugar flow.

lines.line_text: And thrice, in Mirth, he push'd him down,
As thrice he strove to rise.

stanzas.stanza_text:
took rosy Crown,
And gayly wore the Prize,
And thrice, in Mirth, he push'd him down,
As thrice he strove to rise.

lines.line_text: They joyn'd to rail at Wine.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Then  sought the Myrtle Grove,
Where  did recline,
And  close embracing
They joyn'd to rail at Wine.

And  loudly cursing
Roll'd off to some Retreat,
Where boon Companions gravely sit
In fat unweildy State.

lines.line_text: They kiss, and are exceeding kind,

stanzas.stanza_text:
and  still behind,
For one fresh Glass prepare;
They kiss, and are exceeding kind,
And vow to be sincere.

lines.line_text: But part in Time, whoever hear
For tho' such Friendships may be dear,

stanzas.stanza_text:
But part in Time, whoever hear
This our instructive Song;
For tho' such Friendships may be dear,
They can't continue long.
